Comments_List: I gained insight into how business and non-governmental entities can impact states and systems.
This course offered insight into the economic and political challenges of a variety of post-communist/ post-socialist countries.

The guest speakers were hit or miss. The readings the guest speakers assigned were somewhat lacking. At times, it was far too much irrelevant information. Other times, I felt like I was given no background on what the lecture was going to be about. Better framing of the guest speakers' lectures would be useful. I appreciated the comprehensive overview of business and government around the world.
The course was thoroughly enjoyable and engaging. I particularly enjoyed the lunches, which allowed space for more intimate and involved conversations.

I would suggest engaging more students through debates and establishing earlier deadlines for the written work so students can have feedback. The case studies in the final exam (take home version) were interesting, there should be more like these during the term.
Interesting topics, interesting speakers. The options for assignments were a bit confusing, but I appreciated the flexibility.
Yes. Broad scope, both geographically and conceptually.
